result.execSummary:
The defendant Jason Jerome Schlosser was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Defendant to pay costs and DNA surcharge through the Dodge County Clerk of Courts office within 60 days (11/18/16) unless a payment plan has been established.

Defendant shall undergo and follow through with any counseling as recommended by Agent.

Defendant shall undergo and follow through with Anger Management or Domestic Abuse counseling as deemed appropriate by Agent.
Defendant shall not have any direct or indirect contact or communication with B.M.K.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: with work release and transfer privileges

15CM69, 15CF274 Defendant Jason Jerome Schlosser in court with attorney Steven John Luchsinger.  James T. Sempf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Parties heard, court takes a break, case recalled, defendant will plead today.  Court reviews the charges and penalties, def pleads guilty in 15CF74 to cts 2, 3, 4, 8 and in 15CM69 ct 2, court finds plea made FVKI, court accepts plea and finds def guilty.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 19, 2016 at 03:00 pm.   Atty Luchsinger requests the bond be released, state heard, Atty Luchsinger responds, court denies.
Sentencing hearing on September 19, 2016 at 03:00 pm.

11:32.  Defendant, Jason Jerome Schlosser, in court. Attorney James T. Sempf appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court questions Deft. Court finds Deft not eligible for SPD. Off record. Case recalled 11:37. Court heard; appoints Atty Steven Luchsinger, orders payments of $50/mo commencing 10/01/16. Atty Luchsinger appears telephonically at 11:41. Court apprises Atty Luchsinger of situation. Atty Luchsinger takes appointment. Matter to be scheduled for IPSTC.  Status conference scheduled for August 22, 2016 at 12:30 pm.

10:03. (15CF274/15CM69) Attorney Bradley J Jansen appeared by phone means for Defendant, Jason Jerome Schlosser, who appears in person. Atty James T. Sempf appeared for State of Wisconsin. Atty Jansen heard --requests withdrawl. Court questions Deft. Court questions Atty Jansen. No position by the State. Court allows Atty Jansen to withdraw. Deft heard. Atty Jansen heard. Court heard  -orders Deft to go to SPD to see if eligible, fill out eligibility form and return at 11:30 to have hearing on appointment of attorney.  Review hearing scheduled for August 3, 2016 at 11:30 am.
Review hearing on August 3, 2016 at 10:00 am.
